document.docAuthor: Ji, Xiao-Ling, Li, Chong-Yang, Ma, Li & Li, Qiang
document.docTitle: Minagenia fulvifemoralis Ji et Ma, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Minagenia Banks, 1934 (Hymenoptera, Pompilidae) from China, with the key to species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Minagenia Banks, 1934 (Hymenoptera, Pompilidae) from China, with the key to species

heading.emphasis:
Minagenia fulvifemoralis Ji et Ma
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . The new species clearly differs from similar
Minagenia montisdorsa
Dreisbach, 1953
and other congeners by combination of characters: pronotum anteriorly not vertical; gonostylus stout, with long setae apically and medially, inner margin with right angle and long setae medially (
Figs 18, 19
); mid and hind femorae reddish-brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–7.
Minagenia fulvifemoralis
sp. nov.
, ♀. 1. Head, frontal view; 2. Head, dorsal view; 3. Propodeum, dorsal view; 4. Fore wing; 5. Hind wing; 6. Metasoma, lateral view; 7. Hind claw. Scale bar for 1-3 = 1.40 mm; for 4-5 = 1.25 mm; for 6 = 1.00 mm; for 7 = 6.22 mm.

FIGURES 8–21.
Minagenia fulvifemoralis
sp. nov.
, ♂. 8. Head, frontal view; 9. Head, dorsal view; 10. Propodeum, dorsal view; 11. Fore wing; 12. Hind wing; 13. Fore inner claw; 14. Fore outer claw; 15. Mid claw; 16, 17. Hind claws; 18. Genitalia, ventral view; 19. Genitalia, lateral view; 20. Hypopygium (sternum 8), ventral view; 21. Hypopygium, dorsal view. Scale bar for 8-10 = 1.40 mm; for 11-12 = 1.00 mm; for 13-21 = 6.22 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Black; mandible apically reddish-brown, labial and maxillar palpi brown, scape ventrally with yellowish stripe, fore coxae apically pale yellowish-brown, mid and hind femorae reddish-brown, inner side of mid tibia and basal half of hind tibia inconspicuously brown. Head, mesosoma, metasoma and legs with short whitish setae, metasomal sternum 6 with long, whitish setae.

Material examined :
Holotype
: ♀, CHINA : Yunnan: Puer City, Simao County;
20 . ix. 2007
, coll. Xueyan Shi. Paratypes : 1 ♀, CHINA : Yunnan: Puer City, Simao County,
14 . ix. 2007
, coll. Xueyan Shi; 1 ♀, Puer City, Simao County;
30 . ix. 2007
, coll. Xueyan Shi;
1 ♂
, Xishuangbanna Prefecture, Mengla County, Yao Town,
8 . v. 2005
, coll. Peng Wang;
1 ♂
, Dehong Prefecture, Yingjiang County, Tongbiguan Town, Sanhe Village,
2 . v. 2013
, coll. Xiaoling Ji.

Etymology. The specific name
fulvifemoralis
is derived from Latin fulvus , reddish-brown, and femoralis , femur, with reference to reddish-brown mid and hind femorae.
